meanings.definition: To prepare or shape in advance.
meanings.sent1: She preformats her presentation slides before the meeting.
meanings.sent2: He always preformats his emails to save time.
meanings.sent3: The chef preformats the dough for the cookies, so they bake perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The artist preformats the canvas with a sketch before painting.
meanings.sent5: The teacher preformats the lesson plan to ensure a smooth class.

meanings.definition: A format or layout that is prepared in advance.
meanings.sent1: The template is a preformats for the report.
meanings.sent2: She created a preformats for the new brochure design.
meanings.sent3: The preformats for the event program made organizing much easier.
meanings.sent4: The preformats of the website was sleek and modern.
meanings.sent5: He printed out the preformats for the meeting agenda.
